column3: Bitcoin does not use c++11. What's the boost compile error?\n
compiler says: \nambiguous overload for ‘operator=’ (operand types are ‘std::vector<unsigned char>’ and ‘boost::assign_detail::generic_list<int>’)\n
NACK. This causes compile errors on all of our compilers in Travis.\n

Dumb guess is that it doesn't like the single-element ones. Please give this a try:

``` diff
diff --git a/src/chainparams.cpp b/src/chainparams.cpp
index 1ab2925..f1d52a8 100644
--- a/src/chainparams.cpp
+++ b/src/chainparams.cpp
@@ -153,9 +153,9 @@ public:
         vSeeds.push_back(CDNSSeedData("bitnodes.io", "seed.bitnodes.io"));
         vSeeds.push_back(CDNSSeedData("xf2.org", "bitse

2014-10-29 17:14 GMT+08:00 Cory Fields notifications@github.com:

> Dumb guess is that it doesn't like the single-element ones. Please give
> this a try:
> 
> diff --git a/src/chainparams.cpp b/src/chainparams.cppindex 1ab2925..f1d52a8 100644--- a/src/chainparams.cpp+++ b/src/chainparams.cpp@@ -153,9 +153,9 @@ public:
>          vSeeds.push_back(CDNSSeedData("bitnodes.io", "seed.bitnodes.io"
...and what are those errors? Please be sure to provide as much info as possible when reporting build issues.\n

> ...and what are those errors? Please be sure to provide as much info as possible when reporting build issues.

compiler says:
ambiguous overload for ‘operator=’ (operand types are ‘std::vector’ and ‘boost::assign_detail::generic_list’)
@microcai Are you going to try finding a solution that doesn't require c++11?\n

@laanwj  Just don't know what the proper solution will be without c++11

maybe ifdef surrounded ?
@microcai what compiler? what os? Please pastebin the entire build log. We need to figure out why you see this problem that nobody else does.\n

Ok, I managed to track down the problem here. It's only an issue when building bitcoin in c++11 mode, which we don't yet support. Other than this issue, bitcoin seems to build fine as c++11.

I'm not quite sure what the correct fix is here. Here's a patch that just blindly fixes the problem:
https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/b08ef0c736efab9f349df57d34883d8780f9009e

But if we're compil
I'd like to understand how Microcai ended up compiling in C++11 mode in the first place?\n

@gmaxwell ./configure CXXFLAGS="-std=c++11".

The thought crossed my mind (which may be what you're considering as well) that some toolchain is defaulting to c++11 now. But I really just can't imagine that's the case.
